name: 林鳳儀
objective: This course deals with management accounting and control both within a micro-behavioural and within an organisational theory perspective. The aim is to provide an understanding of the developments in management accounting and control theory and practice and the implications of critical variables that affect the design, development and operation of management accounting and control systems. Practical aspects of management accounting are mainly examined through computer assisted learning (CAL). Students are expected to cover the prescribed reading on their own, and to perceive the taught seminars as the opportunity to ask questions and to offer their views at any time.
schedule:
1. Introduction 
2. Financial Statement Introduction
3. Introduction to Managerial Accounting and Job Order Cost systems
4. Cost Information for Decisions
5. Job Costing System
6. Variable Costing System
7. Process Cost Systems
8. Target Costing and Price Planning
9. Profit Reporting for Management Analysis
10. Midterm exam
11. Standard cost system
12. Balanced Scorecard & Strategy Maps
13. Performance Evaluation Using Variances
14. Statement of Cash Flows
15. Lecture
16. Financial Statement Analysis
17. Capital Investment Analysis
18. Final exam
scorePolicy:
Assignment Quits&Participant 40%
Midterm exam 30%
Final exam 30%
materials:
Managerial Accounting
Warren Fess : Managerial accounting, 8th edition.

name: 張志揚
objective:
本課程介紹管理會計和控制等之成本會計概念介紹，本課程之目的在了解管理會計之實務與應用內涵，並藉以設計及發展管理資訊系統另外，本課程也針對與管會相關之介紹(just-in-time, balanced scorecards, profitability center, investment center …等)與管理決策(外包或自製, 增加產品線,績效評估…等)
This course deals with management accounting and control both within a micro-behavioural and within an organisational theory perspective. The aim is to provide an understanding of the developments in management accounting and control theory and practice and the implications of critical variables that affect the design, development and operation of management accounting and control systems. Practical aspects of management accounting are mainly examined through computer assisted learning (CAL). Students are expected to cover the prescribed reading on their own, and to perceive the taught seminars as the opportunity to ask questions and to offer their views at any time.
schedule:
Week 1:  What is managerial accounting?
Week 2:  Cost Concepts and cost classifications
Week 3:  Cost Behavior Analysis 
Week 4:  Cost volume Profit Relationships 
Week 5:  Overview of absorption and variable costing
Week 6:  Cost Allocation and Charges for Services Rendered
Week 7:  Activity-based costing: key definition and brief overview
Week 8:  Process and job-order costing
Week 9:  Midterm Exam
Week 10:  Cost flows in process costing
Week 11:  The basic framework of budgeting
Week 12:  Flexible budgets
Week 13:  Standard costs – Setting the stage
Week 14:  Decentralization in organizations
Week 15:  Cost concepts for decision making
Week 16:  Capital budgeting
Week 17:  Statement of cash flows
Week 18:  Final Exam
